Install smoke detectors and fire alarms: Smoke detectors and fire alarms will alert you to any smoke or fire in your home, allowing you to evacuate quickly.
Keep a fire extinguisher handy: While a fire extinguisher may not be able to put out a large fire, it can be useful for putting out small fires or preventing them from spreading.
Use fire-resistant furniture: Use fire-resistant furniture, such as sofas and chairs, in your home. This will help prevent the fire from spreading to other parts of your home.
Create a fire escape plan: Have a plan in place for how to evacuate your home in case of a fire. Make sure everyone in your household is familiar with the plan.
Keep a fire ladder handy: In case of a fire on a higher floor, keep a fire ladder handy so you can quickly evacuate.
